channel.title: Some Serious Portforwarding help
channel.description: ok im sick of this i have been trying to portforward for like 3 weeks now ive tried everything and it keeps saying 99.10.252.20 on port 43594 is closed reason: connection timed out this is at 'canyouseeme.org' I need some help ive disabled firewalls on both pc and router i think i have a static ip adress ive gone into my router to forward the ports and still nothing ive got no-ip and all that but I dont know what it does or anything like that. anyway any help would be much appreciated :)

item.title: Some Serious Portforwarding help
item.dc:creator: @aerodude30 aerodude30
item.description:
@aerodude30 wrote:

so i have been to the router page many times btw im using lynksys so I dont see a portforwarding tab but if your talking about the one under applications and gaming then im there but i dont see add a service but watever and I have seen my ip i think the external is 99.10.252.** but when i go to the portforwarding page it has the internal ip the 192.168..** and when i got to check if my ports open it always checks with my external idk if this matters or not just thought id let you know and yes i have teamviewer but im not a big fan of random people looking at our entire router system so idk if thats an option for me

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Some Serious Portforwarding help
item.dc:creator: @evanownz evanownz
item.description:
@evanownz wrote:

Go to: http://192.168.1.1/

Login, the common user is “admin”, the common password is “password”

Navigate to portforwarding tab.

Hit ‘Add a Service’

For name put w/e, I suggest RSPS.
Make it TCP/UDP for Starting Type
Starting Port: 43594
Ending Port: 43594

Lastly the Server IP Address can be obtained from opening command prompt and typing in “ipconfig”
It will usually be your IPv4 Address

Tell me if this helps.

Read full topic
